text.0: at the first shining of the earliest mornings in the cows home was born the great eternal.
text.1: now shall the statutes of the gods be valid great is the gods supreme and sole dominion.
text.2: let not the gods here injure us o agni nor fathers of old time who know the region.
text.3: nor the sign set between two ancient dwellings great is the gods supreme and sole dominion.
text.4: my wishes fly abroad to many places i glance back to the ancient sacrifices.
text.5: let us declare the truth when fire is kindled great is the gods supreme and sole dominion.
text.6: king universal born to sundry quarters extended through the wood be lies on couches.
text.7: one mother rests another feeds the infant great is the gods supreme and sole dominion.
text.8: lodged in old plants he grows again in younger swiftly within the newlyborn and tender.
text.9: though they are unimpregned he makes them fruitful great is the gods supreme and sole dominion.
text.10: now lying far away child of two mothers he wanders unrestrained the single youngling.
text.11: these are the laws of varuṇa and mitra great is the gods supreme and sole dominion.
text.12: child of two mothers priest sole lord in synods he still precedes while resting as foundation.
text.13: they who speak sweetly bring him sweet addresses great is the gods supreme and sole dominion.
text.14: as to a friendly warrior when he battles each thing that comes anear is seen to meet him.
text.15: the hymn commingles with the cows oblation great is the gods supreme and sole dominion.
text.16: deep within these the hoary envoy pierceth mighty he goeth to the realm of splendour.
text.17: and looketh on us clad in wondrous beauty great is the gods supreme and sole dominion.
text.18: viṣṇu the guardian keeps the loftiest station upholding dear immortal dwellingplaces.
text.19: agni knows well all these created beings great is the gods supreme and sole dominion.
text.20: ye variant pair have made yourselves twin beauties one of the twain is dark bright shines the other.
text.21: and yet these two the dark the red are sisters great is the gods supreme and sole dominion.
text.22: where the two cows the mother and the daughter meet and give suck yielding their lordly nectar.
text.23: i praise them at the seat of law eternal great is the gods supreme and sole dominion.
text.24: loud hath she lowed licking the others youngling on what world hath the milchcow laid her udder.
text.25: this iḷā streameth with the milk of order great is the gods supreme and sole dominion.
text.26: earth weareth beauties manifold uplifted licking her calf of eighteen months she standeth.
text.27: wellskilled i seek the seat of law eternal great is the gods supreme and sole dominion.
text.28: within a wondrous place the twain are treasured the one is manifest the other hidden.
text.29: one common pathway leads in two directions great is the gods supreme and sole dominion.
text.30: let the milchkine that have no calves storm downward yielding rich nectar streaming unexhausted.
text.31: these who are ever new and fresh and youthful great is the gods supreme and sole dominion.
text.32: what time the bull bellows in other regions another herd receives the genial moisture.
text.33: for he is bhaga king the earths protector great is the gods supreme and sole dominion.
text.34: let us declare the heros wealth in horses o all ye folk of this the gods have knowledge.
text.35: sixfold they bear him or by fives are harnessed great is the gods supreme and sole dominion.
text.36: tvaṣṭar the god the omniform creator begets and feeds mankind in various manner.
text.37: his verily arc all these living creatures great is the gods supreme dominion.
text.38: the two great meeting bowls hath he united each of the pair is laden with histreasure.
text.39: the hero is renowned for gathering riches great is the gods supreme and sole dominion.
text.40: yea and on this our earth the allsustainer dwells like a king with noble friends about him.
text.41: in his protection heroes rest in safety great is the cods supreme and sole dominion.
text.42: rich in their gifts for thee are herbs and waters and earth brings all her wealth for thee o indra.
text.43: may we as friends of thine share goodly treasures great is the gods supreme and sole dominion.
